name: Update a check run

previews.name: antiope
previews.description:
The Checks API is currently available for developers to preview. During the preview period, the API may change without advance notice. Please see the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-05-07-new-checks-api-public-beta/) for full details. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.17/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

```
  application/vnd.github.antiope-preview+json

```

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the check. For example, "code-coverage".

params.name: details_url
params.description: The URL of the integrator's site that has the full details of the check.

params.name: external_id
params.description: A reference for the run on the integrator's system.

params.name: started_at
params.description: This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: status
params.description: The current status. Can be one of `queued`, `in_progress`, or `completed`.

params.name: conclusion
params.description:
**Required if you provide `completed_at` or a `status` of `completed`**. The final conclusion of the check. Can be one of `success`, `failure`, `neutral`, `cancelled`, `timed_out`, or `action_required`.  
**Note:** Providing `conclusion` will automatically set the `status` parameter to `completed`.

params.name: completed_at
params.description: **Required if you provide `conclusion`**. The time the check completed. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: output
params.description: Check runs can accept a variety of data in the `output` object, including a `title` and `summary` and can optionally provide descriptive details about the run. See the [`output` object](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.17/v3/checks/runs/#output-object-1) description.

params.name: output.title
params.description: **Required**.

params.name: output.summary
params.description: Can contain Markdown.

params.name: output.text
params.description: Can contain Markdown.

params.name: output.annotations
params.description: Adds information from your analysis to specific lines of code. Annotations are visible in GitHub's pull request UI. Annotations are visible in GitHub's pull request UI. The Checks API limits the number of annotations to a maximum of 50 per API request. To create more than 50 annotations, you have to make multiple requests to the [Update a check run](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.17/v3/checks/runs/#update-a-check-run) endpoint. Each time you update the check run, annotations are appended to the list of annotations that already exist for the check run. For details about annotations in the UI, see "[About status checks](https://help.github.com/articles/about-status-checks#checks)". See the [`annotations` object](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.17/v3/checks/runs/#annotations-object-1) description for details.

params.name: output.annotations[].path
params.description: The path of the file to add an annotation to. For example, `assets/css/main.css`.

params.name: output.annotations[].start_line
params.description: The start line of the annotation.

params.name: output.annotations[].end_line
params.description: The end line of the annotation.

params.name: output.annotations[].start_column
params.description: The start column of the annotation. Annotations only support `start_column` and `end_column` on the same line. Omit this parameter if `start_line` and `end_line` have different values.

params.name: output.annotations[].end_column
params.description: The end column of the annotation. Annotations only support `start_column` and `end_column` on the same line. Omit this parameter if `start_line` and `end_line` have different values.

params.name: output.annotations[].annotation_level
params.description: The level of the annotation. Can be one of `notice`, `warning`, or `failure`.

params.name: output.annotations[].message
params.description: A short description of the feedback for these lines of code. The maximum size is 64 KB.

params.name: output.annotations[].title
params.description: The title that represents the annotation. The maximum size is 255 characters.

params.name: output.annotations[].raw_details
params.description: Details about this annotation. The maximum size is 64 KB.

params.name: output.images
params.description: Adds images to the output displayed in the GitHub pull request UI. See the [`images` object](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.17/v3/checks/runs/#annotations-object-1) description for details.

params.name: output.images[].alt
params.description: The alternative text for the image.

params.name: output.images[].image_url
params.description: The full URL of the image.

params.name: output.images[].caption
params.description: A short image description.

params.name: actions
params.description: Possible further actions the integrator can perform, which a user may trigger. Each action includes a `label`, `identifier` and `description`. A maximum of three actions are accepted. See the [`actions` object](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.17/v3/checks/runs/#actions-object) description.

params.name: actions[].label
params.description: The text to be displayed on a button in the web UI. The maximum size is 20 characters.

params.name: actions[].description
params.description: A short explanation of what this action would do. The maximum size is 40 characters.

params.name: actions[].identifier
params.description: A reference for the action on the integrator's system. The maximum size is 20 characters.

description:
**Note:** The Checks API only looks for pushes in the repository where the check suite or check run were created. Pushes to a branch in a forked repository are not detected and return an empty `pull_requests` array.

Updates a check run for a specific commit in a repository. Your GitHub App must have the `checks:write` permission to edit check runs.
